for_Database

Class Database

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • for_Database.Database
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class Database
extends javax.swing.JFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    The Database applications let's user's enter new contact information into the Database, save the information in the Database to a file, and load the file into the Database. The Database is similar to an address book that keeps the contact information of people or the information entered.
    Author:
    gtran
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getUserAddress

        public java.lang.String[] getUserAddress()
        A method that gets the user's address from the text fields.
        Returns:
        A collection of Strings that represent the user's street line, optional line, city, state and zipcode in their address.

      • checkForEmptyName

        public boolean checkForEmptyName(java.lang.String[] nameArray)
        A method that checks for empty names.
        Parameters:
        nameArray - A collection of Strings that represent the first name, middle name and the last name that the user entered into the text fields.
        Returns:
        true if there is text in the first name, middle name, and last name text fields. false, if there is no text in the first name, middle name and last name text fields.

      • checkForEmptyAddress

        public boolean checkForEmptyAddress(java.lang.String[] addressArray)
        A method that checks for empty Addresses.
        Parameters:
        addressArray - A collection of Strings that represent the street line, the optional line, the city, the state and the zip code that the user entered into the text fields.
        Returns:
        true if there is text in the street line, optional line, city, state, and zipcode text fields. false if there is no text in the street line, optional line, city, state, and zip ode text fields.
